meanings.definition: A person who is very successful or aggressive in dealing with a particular problem or situation.
meanings.sent1: The young entrepreneur was a real gangbuster in the business world, always coming up with innovative ideas.
meanings.sent2: She tackled the project like a gangbuster, finishing it ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The little girl was a gangbuster at solving puzzles, always finding the hidden pieces with ease.
meanings.sent4: His determination to succeed was like a gangbuster, breaking through any obstacles in his way.
meanings.sent5: The team leader's energy and drive were gangbuster, inspiring everyone to work harder.

meanings.definition: A police officer or law enforcement agent who is dedicated to aggressively pursuing and apprehending members of criminal gangs.
meanings.sent1: The detective was a gangbuster in tracking down the notorious gang members.
meanings.sent2: The city hired a gangbuster to clean up the streets and make them safer for everyone.
meanings.sent3: The police dog was a gangbuster at sniffing out hidden evidence during investigations.
meanings.sent4: The undercover cop worked like a gangbuster, infiltrating the criminal organization.
meanings.sent5: The law enforcement team acted like gangbusters, swiftly capturing the gang leaders.
